title: Philippines annual inflation slows to 1.7% in August - Nasdaq.com
text: MANILA, Sept 5 (Reuters) - Philippine annual inflation was 1.7% in August, easing from a 2.4% climb in the previous month, due to a drop in food and utility prices, the statistics agency said on Thursday.
Economists in a Reuters poll had forecast inflation to ease 1.8% in August, which was within the central bank's 1.3%-2.1% forecast for the month.
